summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1993 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN. WHILE DRIVING 20 MPH, THE BRAKES FAILED WITHOUT WARNING. THE CONTACT DEPRESSED THE BRAKE PEDAL, BUT THE VEHICLE WOULD NOT STOP AND CRASHED INTO THE PRECEDING VEHICLE. THE AIR BAGS DID NOT DEPLOY. A POLICE REPORT WAS NOT FILED. THERE WERE NO INJURIES SUSTAINED. THE VEHICLE WAS ABLE TO BE DRIVEN AWAY FROM THE SCENE. DICK HANNAH CHRYSLER DODGE JEEP RAM IN VANCOUVER, WASHINGTON WAS MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE AND STATED THAT THEY DID NOT HAVE THE PARTS TO REPAIR THE VEHICLE. IN ADDITION, THE DEALER ACKNOWLEDGED THAT A BRAKE FAILURE HAD OCCURRED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE ISSUE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS APPROXIMATELY 222,400. *JS

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1993 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN. WHILE DRIVING 30 MPH, THE BRAKE PEDAL WAS DEPRESSED, BUT HESITATED TO RESPOND. THE ABS WARNING INDICATOR ILLUMINATED. THE BRAKE PEDAL STIFFENED AND TRAVELED TO THE FLOOR BEFORE THE VEHICLE STOPPED. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC WHERE THE TECHNICIAN STATED THAT THE ABS PUMP FAILED AND NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE AND STATED THAT THE VEHICLE WAS PREVIOUSLY SERVICED PER NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 96V099000 (SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC). THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 190,000.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1993 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN. THE CONTACT STATED THAT AN ABNORMAL NOISE EMITTED FROM THE ENGINE COMPARTMENT, BRAKE PUMP, AND BRAKE PEDAL. ALSO, THE ABS WARNING INDICATOR ILLUMINATED. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE BRAKES OPERATED PROPERLY AFTER TEN SECONDS. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO A DEALER WHERE IT WAS DIAGNOSED THAT THE BRAKE ACTUATOR FAILED AND NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. IT WAS UNKNOWN IF THE VEHICLE WAS REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURES. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS APPROXIMATELY 140,000.  UPDATED 09/20/16*LJ  THE BRAKES WORKED WITH THE RELAY CONTINUOUSLY OPERATING, WHICH ACTIVATED THE BRAKE PUMP AND MOTOR ASSEMBLY. THE PROBLEM WAS THE PUMP/MOTOR ASSEMBLY WOULD BURN OUT IF THE VAN WERE DRIVEN FOR ANY LENGTH OF TIME.   UPDATED 09/21/ *JB

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1993 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE BRAKES MALFUNCTIONED AND THE VEHICLE COULD NOT BE OPERATED. IN ADDITION, THE ABS AND BRAKE WARNING INDICATORS ILLUMINATED. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO A DEALER FOR DIAGNOSTIC TESTING, BUT THE RESULTS WERE NOT PROVIDED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 87,000.

MY DODGE CARAVAN HAS A LIFETIME WARRANTY DUE TO A RECALL ON THE ABS BRAKE SYSTEM THAT WAS ORIGINALLY INSTALLED.   TURNS OUT THE ORIGINAL OWNERS BROUGHT THE VAN IN FOR THIS RECALL, BUT THE PART WAS NOT REPLACED. SO YEARS LATER IT GAVE OUT. THE VAN HAS 36K MILES, SO IF IT WAS REPLACED WHEN THE PREVIOUS OWNERS BROUGHT IT IN EVERYTHING WOULD BE FINE. (THE PREVIOUS OWNERS WERE OLDER AND DISABLED, SO I DONT THINK THEY REALIZED NOTHING WAS DONE)   ANYWAYS, DODGE IS REFUSING TO FIX THE ABS SYSTEM, AND TELL ME THEY DON'T HAVE A DIAGNOSIS TOOL, SO THEY CANT FIX IT. MY MECHANIC WAS ABLE TO ID  WHAT WAS WRONG, BUT WAS UNABLE TO ORDER A PART DUE TO THIS LIFETIME RECALL. THEY ARE ALSO SAYING THEY CANT LOCATE THE PARTS IN THE SYSTEM, BUT I FIND THAT HARD TO BELIEVE. WHAT THEY OFFER ME WAS A MADE UP AMOUNT OF WHAT THEY THINK MY VAN IS WORTH (THEY SAID KELLEY BLUE BOOK VALUE IN FAIR CONDITION, WHICH IS NOT CORRECT I COME UP WITH OVER TWICE THAT AMOUNT ON KBB.COM AND MY VAN IS IN VERY GOOD CONDITION AND IS A MOBILITY MODIFIED VAN, MEANING IT HAS A HANDICAP RAMP, BUILT IN TRACKS FOR TIE DOWNS, AND IS DROPPED6-8 INCHES, WITH AIR LIFTS.). WHICH IS 1/3 OF WHAT I CAN SELL IT FOR ON CRAIGSLIST, AND 1/2 OF WHAT I PAID WITH MY RECENT PARTS I PUT IN TO MAKE IT LIKE NEW.  SO HERE'S MY QUESTION, WHAT DOES LIFETIME WARRANTY MEAN ON A RECALL? DO THEY HAVE TO FIX IT? OR AM I STUCK WITH WHAT EVER THEY WANT TO DO? PLEASE ADVISE. THIS WAS AN IMPORTANT VEHICLE, AS IT WAS TO BE USED TO MOVE A HANDICAP PERSON AROUND.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1993 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN. WHILE DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 45 MPH, THE VEHICLE FAILED TO STOP WHEN THE BRAKE PEDAL WAS DEPRESSED. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC FOR DIAGNOSTIC TESTING, BUT WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE VIN WAS EXCLUDED FROM NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 96V099000 (SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC). THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS UNAVAILABLE.

THIS VAN IS SUBJECT TO RECALL 96V099000.  UNDER THIS RECALL THERE IS A LIFETIME WARRANTY ON THE ACTUATOR PISTON ASSEMBLY AND PUMP MOTOR.  THE BREAKS HAVE STOPPED WORKING TWICE PREVIOUSLY AND WERE REPAIRED UNDER THE RECALL.  THE BREAKS STOPPED WORKING FOR THE THIRD TIME.  THE VAN WAS TOWED INTO RICHARDSON CHRYSLER ON JUNE 24, 2013.  CHRYSLER NO LONGER MAKES THE PARTS.  AT FIRST THEY COULD NOT FIND THE PART AND NOW THE SHIPPING DATE CONTINUES TO BE EXTENDED.  NEITHER THE DEALER NOR THE CHRYSLER NATIONAL PARTS SERVICE GROUP CAN TELL ME WHEN THEY WILL GET A PART.  IT IS NOW AUGUST 5, 2013.HOW LONG DO I HAVE TO WAIT FOR A PART ON A LIFETIME WARRANTY?  BECAUSE OF THE AGE OF THE VAN, CHRYSLER REFUSES TO PROVIDE A CAR FOR ME TO DRIVE.  CAN THEY AVOID A LIFETIME WARRANTY BY CLAIMING THEY CAN'T FIND THE PARTS?  I HAVE SPOKEN TO AT LEAST THREE DIFFERENT "CUSTOMER SERVICE" PEOPLE AND THEY ALL TELL ME THEY DON'T KNOW WHEN THE PART WILL BE DELIVERED TO THE DEALER. *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1993 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING 40 MPH, THE BRAKES FAILED WITH THE ILLUMINATION OF THE ANTI-LOCK AND PARKING BRAKE WARNING LIGHTS. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO THE DEALER FOR DIAGNOSIS WHERE IT WAS ADVISED TO THE CONTACT THAT THE PUMP MOTOR ASSEMBLY AND THE BRAKE PINION NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 130,000.  *TR

1993 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN.   CONSUMER WRITES IN REGARDS TO ANTI-LOCK BRAKES SYSTEM RECALL AND SEEKS ASSISTANCE FOR REPAIR WORK.  *SMD  THE DEALER DIAGNOSED THE PROBLEM AS A FAILED BRAKE ACTUATOR PISTON AND PUMP/MOTOR FAILURE. WHILE THE RECALL OUTLINE THE WARRANTY ON MOST OF THE ABS COMPONENTS AS 10 YEARS OR 100, 000, THE COVERAGE FOR THE BRAKE ACTUATOR PISTON ASSEMBLY AND PUMP/MOTOR WAS CLEARLY NOTED AS HAVING LIFETIME COVERAGE. THE DEALER INITIALLY INFORMED THE CONSUMER THE REPAIR, ESTIMATED AT $ 1,710 EXCEEDED THE VALUE OF THE VEHICLE AND WOULD NOT BE COVERED. THE CONSUMER THEN ESCALATED HIS CONCERN TO CHRYSLER CARE CASE MANAGEMENT GROUP IN WHICH THEY STATED THE TIME PERIOD HAD EXPIRED. THE CONSUMER FAXED CHRYSLER DOCUMENTATION REGARDING THE RECALL AND LIFETIME COVERAGE FOR THE COMPONENTS THAT WERE BROKEN, CHRYSLER THEN RESPONDED BY SAYING THE BRAKE FLUID WAS CONTAMINATED AND HENCE THE WARRANTY WOULD NOT BE HONORED. THE CONSUMER THEN FAXED CHRYSLER A RECEIPT FROM A LICENSED REPAIR STATION FOR THE BRAKE WORK DONE. THE CONSUMER BELIEVED CHRYSLER WAS  CREATING EXCUSES NOT TO COVER THE REPAIRS.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1993 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE BRAKES  FAILED. THE CONTACT HAD TO USE BOTH FEET TO APPLY PRESSURE TO THE BRAKE PEDAL IN ORDER FOR THE VEHICLE TO STOP. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO A DEALER FOR INSPECTION BUT THE TECHNICIANS WERE UNABLE TO DIAGNOSE THE FAILURE. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED AND STATED THAT THE VEHICLE WAS NOT INCLUDED IN ANY RECALL. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 138,480.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1993 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN. THE CONTACT STATED THE ABS BRAKE FAILED. THE CONTACT MENTIONED THAT AFTER ENGAGING THE BRAKES IT FAILED TO STOP THE VEHICLE. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER WHO WAS UNABLE TO REPAIR THE PROBLEM. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE WHO DID NOT OFFER ANY ASSISTANCE SINCE THE VEHICLE WAS NOT INCLUDED IN RECALL NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER: 96V099000 (SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC: ANTILOCK). THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 105,000.

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1993 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN.  THE CONTACT NOTICED THAT THE BRAKES FAILED DUE TO NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER 96V09900, WHICH WAS PREVIOUSLY PERFORMED ON THE VEHICLE PRIOR TO ITS PURCHASE.  WHEN THE ABS FAILED, THE ENTIRE BRAKING SYSTEM DID AS WELL.  THE ABS LIGHT ILLUMINATED SEVERAL TIMES BEFORE THE FAILURE OCCURRED.  BECAUSE OF A LIFETIME WARRANTY, HE WOULD BE ABLE TO HAVE THE REPAIR PERFORMED; HOWEVER, THE MANUFACTURER FORBADE THE DEALER FROM PERFORMING THE REPAIR UNLESS SEVERAL OTHER COMPONENTS WERE REPLACED AT THE SAME TIME.  THE CONTACT WOULD HAVE TO BE REPAIRED AT THE CONTACT'S EXPENSE.  THE CURRENT AND FAILURE MILEAGES WERE APPROXIMATELY 154,000.
ABS MALFUNCTION.  ABS LIGHT ALONG WITH THE BRAKE LIGHT COMES ON WHEN THE BRAKE PEDAL IS DEPRESSED.  *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1993 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN.  WHEN THE VEHICLE IS STARTED, THE ABS AND BRAKE LIGHTS REMAIN ILLUMINATED.  WHILE DRIVING 45 MPH, THE CONTACT MUST APPLY INTENSE PRESSURE TO THE BRAKE PEDAL IN ORDER TO STOP THE VEHICLE.  THE DEALER STATED THAT THE ABS PUMP WAS DEFECTIVE AND THAT THERE WAS A RECALL FOR THE FAILURE; HOWEVER, THE MANUFACTURER STATED THAT HIS VIN WAS NOT INCLUDED.  THE VIN, POWERTRAIN, AND RECALL NUMBER WERE UNKNOWN.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 195,000 AND CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 197,088.

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1993 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN.  THE CONTACT WAS UNABLE TO DEPRESS THE BRAKE PEDAL.  HE RECEIVED A RECALL NOTICE FOR THE SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC: ANTILOCK (NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER 96V099000).  THE DEALER MADE THE RECALL REPAIR; HOWEVER, THE FAILURE WAS NOT INCLUDED IN THE RECALL.  THE CONTACT FELT THAT THE RECALL REPAIR WAS NEVER PERFORMED.  THE CURRENT AND FAILURE MILEAGES WERE 164,000.

1993 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN RECALL ON THE ANTI-LOCK BRAKES. CONSUMER STATES HE HAS HAD HIS BRAKES REPAIRED TWICE FOR THE SAME RECALL PROBLEM. MECHANIC WANTS THE CONSUMER TO PAY FOR THE REPAIRS. ABS HAS FAILED SEVEN TIMES.  *KB  THE CONSUMER STATED THE PUMP, MOTOR ASSEMBLY, ACCUMULATOR DUAL PRESSURE SWITCH HAS BEEN REPLACED SEVERAL TIMES.*JB

THE CAR HAD A STRONG ODOR OF GAS AFTER I STARTED IT. I OPENED THE HOOD AND SAW GAS ALL OVER THE VALVE COVERS AND IT WAS COMING FROM BOTH ENDS OF THE FUEL RAIL CROSSOVER TUBE. I WAS VERY LUCKY IT DIDN'T START A FIRE AND BURN MY HOUSE DOWN SINCE THERE WAS FUEL ALL OVER THE EXHAUST MANIFOLDS AND WIRING. I HAVE GONE TO THE DEALER TO ORDER A NEW PART. THIS SEAMS LIKE A SERIOUS SAFETY ISSUE THAT CAN HAVE DEADLY RESULTS.  *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1993 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN.  THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE FRONT AUTOMATIC SEAT BELT RETRACTOR WOULD NOT PULL OUT.  THE SEAT BELT RESTRAINTS WERE VERY LOOSE.  THE DEALER REPLACED THE SEAT BELT ASSEMBLY, BUT THE FAILURE RECURRED TWO WEEKS LATER.  THE DEALER STATED THAT THE CAUSE OF FAILURE MAY BE THE SWITCH THAT IS USED TO DETERMINE IF THE DOOR IS AJAR.  HOWEVER, THE DEALER DOES NOT KNOW HOW TO CORRECT THE FAILURE.  THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 148,000 AND FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 100,000.

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1993 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN.  THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE ANTILOCK BRAKE SYSTEM PUMP HAS BEEN SHORT CYCLING AND MAKING A NOISE.  HE NOTIFIED THE DEALER AND THE MANUFACTURER AND THEY SENT HIM A LETTER REGARDING THE COMPLAINT HE FILED.  THE LETTER STATED THAT THIS WAS NOT A SAFETY DEFECT AND THAT NOTHING COULD BE DONE.  THE SPEED WAS UNKNOWN.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 211,000 AND CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 225,000.

MY ABS SYSTEM FAILS INTERMITTENTLY, LEAVING ME WITH NO POWER BRAKES. IT WORKS FINE 98% OF THE TIME, BUT FAILS WITHOUT WARNING. IT HAS DONE THIS NUMEROUS TIMES. THE DEALER HAS ADVISED ME TO BRING IT IN 'WHEN IT IS NOT WORKING. MY REGULAR MECHANIC HAS PINPOINTED THE PROBLEM, BUT THE DEALERSHIP WILL NOT ACCEPT HIS EVALUATION. IT APPEARS THAT THE PUMP FAILS TO TURN ON WHEN SIGNALED TO DO SO, AND TAPPING ON THE PUMP SEEMS TO GET IT TO WORK.  *TR

VEHICLE IS BEING REPAIRED FOR RECALLED FAILED BRAKE PUMP. THE VEHICLE HAS BEEN INOPERABLE FOR 6 MONTHS NOW, WHILE THIS PART IS ON BACKORDER. I BELIEVE I HAVE BEEN PATIENT IN THIS MATTER CONCERNING THIS ITEM. THE PARTICULAR PART IS COVERED BY A LIFETIME WARRANTY AND WAS REPLACED BY THE PREVIOUS OWNER ALSO. I THINK WITH THIS AMOUNT OF TIME, DODGE SHOULD PROVIDE SOME KIND OF REPLACEMENT VEHICLE UNTIL MY VEHICLE IS FIXED. I HAVE CONTACTED DODGE VIA EMAIL CONCERNING THE MATTER. *NM

POWER BREAKS FAILED AND ALMOST CAUSE AN ACCIDENT BECAUSE THE PETAL WENT ROCK HARD AND WOULD NOT STOP THE VAN SAFELY. I TOOK IT TO THE DEALER, THEY CHARGED ME $600. AND IT FAILED AGAIN WITH THE SAME RESULTS, I PARKED THE VAN AND HAVEN'T DRIVEN IT SINCE AS IT IS UNSAFE TO DRIVE. THIS NEEDS TO BE REPAIRED, I CAN'T DRIVE THE VAN AND I CAN'T SELL IT.  *NM

DT*: THE CONTACT STATED WHILE DRIVING 5 MPH IN REVERSE, THE BRAKE PEDAL BECAME EXCEEDINGLY DIFFICULT TO DEPRESS, AND EXCESSIVE FORCE WAS REQUIRED TO STOP THE VEHICLE.  A SERVICE DEALER AS WELL AS A PRIVATE REPAIR SHOP HAD INSPECTED THE VEHICLE ON SEVERAL OCCASIONS.  THE PROBLEM WAS DETERMINED TO BE DUE TO THE ABS FAILING.  THE SERVICE DEALER DETERMINED THAT THE FAILURE WAS DUE TO A MANUFACTURER DEFECT.  THERE WAS A NHTSA RECALL # 96V099000 WHICH PERTAINED TO THE ANTILOCK SERVICE BRAKES.  THE VEHICLE WAS NOT INCLUDED IN THE RECALL DUE TO THE VIN.  UPDATED 9/20/2006 - THE SEAT BELTS, AIR BAG AND WINDSHIELD WIPERS MALFUNCTIONED. *NM

CONSUMER COMPLAINT CONCERNING THE DIAGNOSTIC SERVICE ON THE ABS SYSTEM IN 1993 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN .  *TS  ***NAR***  THE CONSUMER'S VEHICLE SAT FOR AN ENTIRE WEEK WITHOUT BEING DIAGNOSED BEFORE BEING TOLD THAT THEY WOULD NOT BE ABLE TO DIAGNOSE THE VEHICLE.  THE DEALER TOLD THE CONSUMER TO TAKE IT TO  ANOTHER DEALER.  NO EXPLANATION WAS GIVEN.   THE MANUFACTURER WAS CONTACTED BUT THE PROVIDED LITTLE ASSISTANCE.  *NM

2004 THE PUMP AND MOTOR ASSEMBLY WERE REPLACED AND THE PISTON.  APPARENTLY THERE WAS A BRAKE LINE AND VALVE ASSEMBLY AND THAT HAD TO BE REPLACED THAT WERE NOT COVERED UNDER THE ABS RECALL AND I PAID $196.18.  3/23/06 THE BRAKES FAILED ON THIS VEHICLE AND IT WAS TOWED IN. MECHANIC SAID, "ABS SYSTEM FAILURE - ABS UNIT NEEDS TO BE REPLACED." TOWED TO THE DEALERSHIP.  DEALER DID NOT LOG THE CAR INTO THE SYSTEM FOR 3 DAYS.   THE VAN WAS OUT OF SERVICE 9 DAYS.  THE ACTUATOR PISTON AND PUMP/MOTOR ASSEMBLY WERE REPLACED.  CHRYSLER AGREED TO PAY FOR 3 DAYS OF THE RENTAL CAR SINCE THAT WAS ALL THE CAR WAS LOGGED IN AT THE DEALER.  ON 6/27/06 THE BRAKE AND ABS LIGHTS CAME ON TOOK VAN BACK TO THE DEALER. 6/29/06 I WAS CALLED BY THE SERVICE MANAGER AND TOLD THAT THERE WAS A BENDIX SYSTEM FAILURE THAT WAS COVERED BY THE RECALL AND LIFETIME PARTS WARRANTY.  THE PART WAS ORDERED BUT WOULD NOT BE AVAILABLE UNTIL 7/28/06.  IT WAS SUGGESTED I CALL CHRYSLER AND LET THEM KNOW SINCE I AM AGAIN IN A RENTAL CAR.  ON 6/30/06 I CALLED CHRYSLER AND WAS ON THE PHONE ABOUT 45 MINUTES.  I TALKED WITH JACK WHO TOOK INFORMATION, SAID HE WOULD CONTACT THE DEALERSHIP ABOUT THE DELAY IN GETTING THE PART AND CHECK FOR THE AVAILABILITY OF A LOANER CAR AND THEN CAME BACK ON AND SAID HE WAS PUTTING ME THROUGH TO A REPRESENTATIVE WHO WOULD AUTHORIZE MY RENTAL.  I WAS TRANSFERRED TO JASON.  HE REVIEWED MY REQUEST AND THEN SAID NO RENTAL ASSISTANCE WOULD BE AUTHORIZED BECAUSE 1) THE DEALER LIED AND THE PART IS NOT COVERED BY THE RECALL AND, 2) THE CAR IS 13 YEARS OLD AND HAS 150,000 MILES ON IT.  I ASKED IF DODGE PRODUCTS WERE ONLY TO LAST 150,000 MILES AND HE RUDELY TOLD ME THAT ALL HE COULD SUGGEST WAS THAT I CALL THE DEALERSHIP AND HIS DECISION WAS FINAL.  I CALLED THE SERVICE MANAGER BACK AND TOLD HIM ABOUT MY CONVERSATION AND THE ACCUSATIONS OF THE CUSTOMER SERVICE REPRESENTATIVE AND HE ASSURED ME THE BENDIX SYSTEM PART WAS COVERED UNDER THE LIFETIME WARRANTY.  HE SAID HE WOULD CHECK INTO IT AND CALL ME BACK.  *JB

DT*:  THE CONTACT STATED THE ABS SYSTEM MALFUNCTIONED.  THE BRAKE PEDAL FELT HARD AND THERE IS AN EXTENDED STOPPING DISTANCE AT ANY SPEED.  THE PROBLEM IS ONLY INTERMITTENT AT THIS TIME.  THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER WHO DETERMINED THE ACCUMULATOR, AND MULTI PRESSURE SWITCH ON THE ABS NEEDED TO BE REPLACED.  THERE IS RECALL #96V099000, CONCERNING THE ANTI-LOCK BRAKES.  THE VIN WAS INCLUDED IN THE RECALL; HOWEVER THE PART WAS NOT REPLACED BECAUSE IT HAD NOT FAILED.  THE CONTACT IS CONCERNED THE OTHER PARTS SHOULD HAVE BEEN INCLUDED IN THE INITIAL RECALL.  THE CONTACT IS ALSO AWARE OF SEVERAL INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE HAVING THE SAME PROBLEM.

I PURCHASED A 93 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN IN 8/05. ON 8/29 I HAD TO EVACUATE KATRINA (BILOXI,MS) TO NC.  I PARKED THE VAN AND WENT TO WORK ON NORWEIGAN CRUISELINE IN HAWAII. I RETURNED TO NC LAST WEEK. UPON STARTING THE VAN TODAY, GASOLINE WAS LEAKING OUT ONTO THE MANIFOLD FROM THE FUEL RAIL O RING. I CALLED DODGE ABOUT A RECALL AND WAS TOLD IF IT WAS A 1996 THEY WOULD FIX IT, BUT EVEN WITH THE THREAT OF A ENGINE FIRE IF DRIVEN, THEY WOULDNT HELP ME. I AM WAITING (LIKE MANY OTHERS) FOR FEMA $ AND NOW HAVE NO VEHICLE TO DRIVE.  I FEEL THIS IS A MANUFACTURER PROBLEM, THEREFORE WHY I AM SUBMITTING A COMPLAINT. DO I HAVE ANY RIGHTS OVER THIS?????  *NM

DT:  THE CONTACT STATED THERE WAS A RECALL ON  THIS VEHICLE TWO YEARS AGO. HE TOOK VEHICLE TO THE DEALERSHIP TO HAVE  RECALL REPAIR WORK PERFORMED.   CURRENTLY, THE  VEHICLE IS DOING THE SAME THING THAT IT WAS DOING  TWO YEARS AGO BEFORE HE TOOK IT IN FOR  RECALL REPAIRS.   THE CONTACT'S  WIFE COULD  BARELY GET THE VEHICLE TO STOP. IT HAD  NO BRAKE POWER ASSIST, THE PEDAL WAS ROCK HARD. THE ABS AND THE BRAKE LIGHTS COME ON AND STAYED ON.  *AK

DT:  CONTACT'S SON FOUND OUT ABOUT A RECALL ON THE BRAKE SYSTEM.  THE BRAKES FAILED AND THE VEHICLE WAS NOT BEING USED AT THIS TIME. THE DEALER TOLD THE CONTACT  THAT THE PART WAS ON BACK ORDER. THEY HAVE NO RELEASE DATE FOR THE PART. THE PART IS THE BRAKE HYDRAULIC ASSEMBLY. SHE HAS BEEN WAITING FOR TWO MONTHS FOR THE PART. MANUFACTURER SAID TO CHECK WITH OTHER DEALERSHIPS.*AK

CONSUMER HAD BRAKE PROBLEMS, BRAKES WERE REPLACED FOR A RECALL. CONSUMER LATER HAD TO REPLACE VALVES DUE TO RUST.  *TS THE CONSUMER STATED THE RECALL KIT THAT WAS USED DID NOT CORRECT THE PROBLEM WITH THE BRAKES. *JB

FRONT DRIVERS SIDE SEAT BELT RETRACTOR IS FROZEN AND SEAT BELT CANNOT BE WORN.  MADE REPEATED ATTEMPTS AT GETTING THE BELT TO LOOSEN UP AND ALL ATTEMPTS FAILED.  DEALER TELLS ME THE REPAIR WILL COST $328 TO REPLACE THE ASSEMBLY. I AM CURRENTLY DRIVING THE VEHICLE ILLEGALLY AND I'M LAUGHABLY SURPRISED THAT THE NHTSA, GIVEN THAT THERE ARE 13 COMPLAINTS FOR THIS SAME COMPONENT ISSUE ALREADY FOR THIS MODEL YEAR ALONE, HAS NOT ISSUED A SAFETY RECALL.  ARE SEAT BELTS NO LONGER A SAFETY COMPONENT OR CONCERN FOR THE AGENCY THAT FIRST MANDATED THEIR USE?  CHRYSLER WILL NOT COVER THIS REPAIR. *JB

I HAVE A 1993 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN WITH A FAILED ABS SYSTEM. THEY SAID THE HYDRALIC CYL. ASSEMBLY AND ACCUMULATOR WERE BAD. CAMPAIGN # 96V099000 .MY DODGE DEALER SAYS THE PARTS ARE NO LONGER AVAILABLE , YET WANTS TO REPLACE THE ABS PUMP AND CHARGE ME $400+. IT SEEMS THEY DO NOT INTEND TO REPLACE THE IN WARRANTY (UNAVAILABLE PARTS) WITH ANYTHING. THIS IS NOT TO MAY SATISFACTION! THE ABS SYSTEM FAILED TWO YEARS AGO, BUT APPARENTLY HAS NOT HELDUP TO THE 100,000 MILE WARRANTY. MILES ARE STILL UNDER 100,000 MILES.
FAULTY TRANSMISSION, TRANS FAILS TO SHIFT AND FAILS TO GO INTO GEAR
THE ABS CHECK LIGHT REMAINSEDON AND CAUSED THE ANTI-LOCK BRAKES NOT TO OPERATE PROPERLY, WHICH  PREVENTED  VEHICLE FROM STOPPING CORRECTLY. CONSUMER CONTACTED THE MANUFACTURER.*AK

RE: 1993 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN.  YELLOW ABS AND RED BRAKE WARNING LIGHTS CAME ON ACCOMPANIED BY SUDDEN LOSS OF POWER BRAKE ASSIST.  I MANAGED TO AVOID SEVERAL POTENTIAL ACCIDENTS BY INCREASING FOLLOWING DISTANCE AND BRAKING EARLY.  I TOOK THE VAN TO DOWNS GARAGE, MY CUSTOMARY REPAIR PLACE. ABERNETHY REFUSED TO ACCEPT THE VEHICLE, GIVING TWO DIFFERING ACCOUNTS CONCERNING THE RECALL/WARRANTY.*AK

THIS COMPLAINT IS IN REFERENCE TO NHTSA RECALL, CAMPAAIGN ID NUMBER: 99V213000.  ON 2/12/05, THE LIFTGATE BOLTS ON MY 1993 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN FAILED SUDDENLY.  THE DODGE DEALER WOULD NOT HONOR THE RECALL AND REPAIR THE PROBLEM.  INSTEAD, I WAS CHARGED $201.18 FOR THE REPAIR.  I THINK THAT THE DAIMERCHRYSLER CORPORATION SHOULD HONOR THEIR RESPONSIBILITY TO REPAIR THE PROBLEM AS STIPULATED IN THE RECALL NOTICE.*AK
WHILE DRIVING THROUGH STANDING WATER, SERPENTINE BELT COMES OFF.  *JB

CONSUMER COMPLAINED ABOUT A  BRAKE PROBLEM. . WHEN THEY WERE APPLIED, THE VEHICLE SLOWLY HESITATED TO STOP. CONSUMER TOOK VEHICLE TO GET  IT SERVICED APPROXIMATELY THREE MONTHS AGO FOR THIS PROBLEM. CURRENTLY THIS SAME PROBLEM RECURRED. ONE HAD TO VERY FIRMLY APPLY PRESSURE TO THE BRAKES IN ORDER FOR THE VEHICLE TO STOP.*AK
ABS SYSTEM FAILURE - DEALER REFUSES TO FIX PROBLEM. THERE IS A RECALL FOR THIS PROBLEM DATED APR 19 1996 - NHTSA CAMPAING # 96V09900 - OVER 320,000 VEHICLES AFFECTED.

POWER DRIVER'S SEAT STRUCTURAL FAILURE.  SEAT BACK HAS BECOME LOOSE FROM SEAT BASE AND WILL ROCK BACK AND FORTH UPON PRESSURE ON THE ARM REST AND DURING BREAKING AND ACCELLERATION.  ALL ELECTRICAL COMPONENTS STILL WORK.  DEALER CLAIMS PARTS NO LONGER AVAILABLE FRO REPAIR, REFERED ME TO JUNK YARD.

THE SRS AIR BAG LIGHT APPEARED ON THE DASHBOARD AND REMAINED ON. CONSUMER  NOTICED THAT WHEN DRIVING THE AIR BAG LIGHT APPEARED ON THE DASHBOARD ON ITS ON.  CONSUMER TOOK VEHICLE TO DEALER FOR INSPECTION. *AK
PAINT PEELING.  *JB

CONSUMER RECEIVED NHTSA RECALL 96V099000 CONCERNING BRAKES:HYDRAULIC:ANTI-SKID SYSTEM.   AFTER HAVING RECALL REPAIRS  DONE THE BRAKES FAILED AGAIN.  MECHANIC REPLACED THE ABS CONTROL MODULE THREE TIMES.   HOWEVER, THE PROBLEM  RECURRED.  *AK

FROM: JOE TINER  RE: RECALL OF ANTI SKID (ABS) SYSTEM IN 1993 DODGE CARAVAN AND THE REFUSAL OF MEADOR CHRYSLER SERVICE DEPARTMENT IN FORT WORTH TEXAS TO DO THE REQUIRED REPAIRS.
